title: Boolean AND True Iff
description:
Prove the logical characterization of `andb`: the conjunction `andb a b` is `true` if and only if both `a` and `b` are `true`.

**Goal:** `forall a b : bool, andb a b = true <-> a = true /\ b = true`

This proof requires handling both directions of the `<->` (iff) connective using `split`, and case analysis on the boolean values.
hints: Use `split` to separate the proof into two directions (forward and backward)
For the forward direction, use `destruct a; destruct b` and `discriminate` to rule out impossible cases
For the backward direction, use `intros [Ha Hb]` to decompose the conjunction, then `rewrite` both hypotheses

solution:
Theorem andb_true_iff : forall a b : bool, andb a b = true <-> a = true /\ b = true.
Proof.
  intros a b. split.
  - intro H. destruct a; destruct b; simpl in H; try discriminate.
    split; reflexivity.
  - intros [Ha Hb]. rewrite Ha. rewrite Hb. simpl. reflexivity.
Qed.
